column5: It's always a pain trying to get rods out of the locker cause they always catch on each other, so I finally decided to catch up to the 21st century and order some sleeves for them.  I contacted Phil but he didn't have any but he put me on to a guy he knows who makes them.  I called the manufacturer and told him that I needed a bunch of sleeves to fit musky rods and he said it wasn't a problem and just tell him exactly what sizes I needed and he made them to custom fit each rod. He made them up, put them in the mail and I had them 2 days later.  Fantastic service !!  Sure is nice to be able to put them in the lockers and bring them back out without everything getting hung up.  They were only $6.00 each and shipping was $9.00 total from Brampton area to my place.  Not trying to SPAM here, just passing along some info on a great company to deal with. If anyones interested his website is WWW.CCRODSOCKS.COM  For some reason I can't post a link  Here's some of the covers.    And here they are nicely tucked into the front locker. There's more in a side locker too.
Very nice Lew. Let's see if this link works. http://www.ccrodsocks.com/
Thanks Roy, that's the one.  I can't ever get the properties for a link with Google Chrome so I usually just switch back to IE but even that wouldn't work today.
I'm using Google Chrome with no issues Lew, just copy and paste the url. http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=64475&pid=718208&st=0&&do=findComment&comment=718208

Thanks Chris, I've never done it that way before. I normally just copy the properties and paste but couldn't get it with that site.  Guess you really can teach an old dog new tricks  http://www.ccrodsocks.com/contactus.htm
I've been using those sleeves for a couple of seasons Lew, I agree they're a great product.
I wish now I'd bought them years ago Mike, they'll save alot of aggravation.
I agree Lew, the best way to transport your rods.  Great protection and no tangled mess!!
